captions.text:
[lieutenant dan]
top smoke.
Get it up there.

<i>If I'd have known</i>
<i>this was going to be</i>

<i>The last time</i>
<i>me and bubba was gonna talk,</i>

<i>I'd of thought of</i>
<i>something better to say.</i>

<i>Then bubba said something</i>
<i>I won't ever forget.</i>

That ain't something you can
find just around the corner.

<i>Bubba was going to be</i>
<i>a shrimping boat captain,</i>

But instead, he died right there
by that river in vietnam.

title: Bubba Goes Home - Forrest Gump (4/9) Movie CLIP (1994) HD

away from the fact that she is a bitch and only came crawling to Forrest 
when she needed support.

comments.text:
I saw this movie when I was like seven and the quote "Bubba was supposed to 
be a shrimp boat captain but instead he died on that river in Vietnam" 
always stuck with me. Really puts the face on the number of people who died 
in a war. How even tho bubba was just one of millions to die in a war and 
just some grunt, he still was a person who was SUPPOSED to do something in 
his life. 

I went into history for school and I always remembered that when we would 
talk about war stats and how some wars "weren't that bad", but how even 
just 1 person dying in a battle might be an "acceptable loss" it still was 
a person who didn't get to do what they wanted to do in life. Puts the flaw 
of human nature and war into perspective to me. ﻿
comments.author: bbz232

comments.text:
my great uncle lost every one of his friends in the second world war, that 
never had any significance to me until i saw this movie. when forrest said 
"Bubba was supposed to be a shrimp boat captain but instead he died on that 
river in Vietnam" i realized that people who died in wars had hopes and 
dreams, and all of them were shattered by death.

comments.author: MisterD2013

comments.text:
This movie is so amazing, it touches every single human emotion known, it's 
sad, sweet, bad and other feelings, how much more emotion could you take 
from the movie?
Jenny had a 'not-very good' life, bad things happened to her by her father, 
she gets kicked out of her college, and then leaves Forrest Gump 3 or maybe 
4 times. Forrest and Jenny were friends, then two best people in the 
relationship before leaving Forrest the first time. Forrest was through a 
long trip to Vietnam, then gets into war. What else could you expect from 
them? He has a talk at the White House until his love of his life see's him 
again, they see each other again; making them peas and carrots again! She 
then leaves him again after he sees the man slap her, he then makes a long 
run for three years with more and more people following him and talking 
about him on the news. Forrest turns back and goes home. When he was on a 
lawnmower, just like that, she was there, they see each other yet again! He 
then sees her a long time later, and finds out that he has a son that is so 
sweet, they marry each other and finds out that Jenny had a disease or 
virus. They spend each other's final days, she dies on the morning of a 
beautiful Saturday. How much more unhappiness could Forrest expect?! It's 
such an amazing movie, and very emotional too. If you don't cry about the 
sad scenes and things of the movie, you have no soul in your heart. If you 
agree with me, leave a like and/or reply below.﻿
